title: Ticket #2931: Reconfig can cause negotiation cycle failure
description:
Reconfigs can take a long time and in some cases cause a disruption in communication that causes failure in the negotiation cycle. The previous code only blocked the group tree building parts of the cycle and not the daemoncore part. Blocking in the cycle has to be selective due to: 

   // Service any interactive commands on our command socket.
  // This keeps condor_userprio hanging to a minimum when
  // we are involved in a lot of schedd negotiating.
  // It also performs the important function of draining out
  // any reschedule requests queued up on our command socket, so
  // we do not negotiate over & over unnecesarily.
remarks:
2012-Apr-10 12:29:36 by eje:
Test scenario:

Using the following configuration: 

NEGOTIATOR_DEBUG = D_FULLDEBUG | D_SECURITY
NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL = 30
NEGOTIATOR_CYCLE_DELAY = 5

CLAIM_WORKLIFE = 0

NUM_CPUS = 20

# easter egg, allows delay/duration to be inserted into negotiator cycles.
NEG_SLEEP = 30

Spin up a pool, and follow the negotiator log with the following grep: 

$ tail -f NegotiatorLog | grep -e ' Cycle ' -e 'GRANTED.*RECONFIG' -e 'GRANTED.*GetPriority' -e 'begin sleep' -e 'end sleep' -e 'Delaying reconfig' -e 'NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL ='
04/10/12 09:49:10 ---------- Started Negotiation Cycle ----------
04/10/12 09:49:10 ---------- Finished Negotiation Cycle ----------

In a second window, submit a few jobs, like so: 

universe = vanilla
cmd = /bin/sleep
args = 30
should_transfer_files = if_needed
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit
+AccountingGroup = "none.user0000"
queue 4

Watch the negotiator log, until you see the first sleep delay: 

$ tail -f NegotiatorLog | grep -e ' Cycle ' -e 'GRANTED.*RECONFIG' -e 'GRANTED.*GetPriority' -e 'begin sleep' -e 'end sleep' -e 'Delaying reconfig' -e 'NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL ='
04/10/12 09:49:10 ---------- Started Negotiation Cycle ----------
04/10/12 09:49:10 ---------- Finished Negotiation Cycle ----------
04/10/12 09:49:15 ---------- Started Negotiation Cycle ----------
04/10/12 09:49:15 begin sleep: 30 seconds

Now submit the following reconfig + userprio sequence. This command will initially wait, just let it go: 

$ condor_reconfig -neg ; condor_userprio

The first sleep delay will end, and the reconfig will be serviced, but it will delay. You should now see the following in your two windows: 

$ tail -f NegotiatorLog | grep -e ' Cycle ' -e 'GRANTED.*RECONFIG' -e 'GRANTED.*GetPriority' -e 'begin sleep' -e 'end sleep' -e 'Delaying reconfig' -e 'NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL ='
04/10/12 09:49:10 ---------- Started Negotiation Cycle ----------
04/10/12 09:49:10 ---------- Finished Negotiation Cycle ----------
04/10/12 09:49:15 ---------- Started Negotiation Cycle ----------
04/10/12 09:49:15 begin sleep: 30 seconds
04/10/12 09:49:45 end sleep: 30 seconds
04/10/12 09:49:45 PERMISSION GRANTED to unauthenticated@unmapped from host 192.168.1.2 for command 60012 (DC_RECONFIG_FULL), access level WRITE: reason: WRITE authorization policy allows access by anyone
04/10/12 09:49:45 Delaying reconfig.
04/10/12 09:49:45 begin sleep: 30 seconds


$ condor_reconfig -neg ; condor_userprio
Sent "Reconfig" command to negotiator eje@localhost.localdomain

Next, the second sleep completes, and then the userprio is serviced. This will not be delayed. Now you should see the following in your two windows: 

$ tail -f NegotiatorLog | grep -e ' Cycle ' -e 'GRANTED.*RECONFIG' -e 'GRANTED.*GetPriority' -e 'begin sleep' -e 'end sleep' -e 'Delaying reconfig' -e 'NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL ='
04/10/12 09:49:10 ---------- Started Negotiation Cycle ----------
04/10/12 09:49:10 ---------- Finished Negotiation Cycle ----------
04/10/12 09:49:15 ---------- Started Negotiation Cycle ----------
04/10/12 09:49:15 begin sleep: 30 seconds
04/10/12 09:49:45 end sleep: 30 seconds
04/10/12 09:49:45 PERMISSION GRANTED to unauthenticated@unmapped from host 192.168.1.2 for command 60012 (DC_RECONFIG_FULL), access level WRITE: reason: WRITE authorization policy allows access by anyone
04/10/12 09:49:45 Delaying reconfig.
04/10/12 09:49:45 begin sleep: 30 seconds
04/10/12 09:50:15 end sleep: 30 seconds
04/10/12 09:50:15 PERMISSION GRANTED to unauthenticated@unmapped from host 192.168.1.2 for command 451 (GetPriority), access level READ: reason: READ authorization policy allows access by anyone
04/10/12 09:50:16 begin sleep: 30 seconds

(note, my userprio output was empty since I started with clean condor state) 

$ condor_reconfig -neg ; condor_userprio
Sent "Reconfig" command to negotiator eje@localhost.localdomain
Last Priority Update:  4/10 09:49

------------------------------      ---------
------------------------------      ---------
Number of users shown: 0

$ tail -f NegotiatorLog | grep -e ' Cycle ' -e 'GRANTED.*RECONFIG' -e 'GRANTED.*GetPriority' -e 'begin sleep' -e 'end sleep' -e 'Delaying reconfig' -e 'NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL ='
